turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I need some fashion advice. I'm trying to revamp my wardrobe, but I'm on a really tight budget. Like, REALLY tight. Think less than $200 total. Is that even possible?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Absolutely! Revamping your wardrobe on a $200 budget is achievable with some smart choices. To give you the best recommendations, what kind of clothing are you primarily looking for? (e.g., work clothes, casual wear, a mix?)

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Mostly casual wear, things I can wear everyday. I need something versatile. And, honestly, I'm so tired of jeans and t-shirts. I want to look a bit more...put together, I guess? But comfortable! This is harder than I thought.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, versatile and put-together casual wear under $200. Consider these options focusing on mix-and-match potential: 1) A neutral-colored midi skirt (think black, navy, or olive) from stores like SHEIN or Amazon for around $20-$30. 2) A couple of basic tops - a fitted knit top and a flowy blouse - in complementary colors (around $15-$20 each). 3) A versatile cardigan or light jacket ($30-$40 from stores like Target or Old Navy). 4) Comfortable sneakers or flats in a neutral color ($40-$60). This leaves some room for accessories from thrift stores or affordable retailers. How does this sound so far?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That sounds...doable, I suppose. But here's my problem: I'm short, and midi skirts usually make me look even shorter and frumpier. How can I make a midi skirt work for my body type without spending a fortune on tailoring?
